articles.description: An emotional Andy Murray dedicates a hard-earned Davis Cup win to his grandmother Ellen after revealing he missed her funeral to play.
articles.title: Murray dedicates win to grandma after missing funeral

articles.description: New Zealand storm to their 50th win at the Rugby World Cup as they thrash Namibia, but lose Ethan de Groot to a late red card for a dangerous collision.
articles.title: New Zealand thrash Namibia but De Groot sent off

articles.description: Opener Jason Roy should remain in England's World Cup squad despite not taking part in the series against New Zealand, according to James Anderson.
articles.title: England should take Roy to World Cup - Anderson

articles.description: Manchester United boss Erik ten Hag says he does not know if Jadon Sancho will play for the club again.
articles.title: Ten Hag unsure if Sancho will play for Man Utd again

articles.description: Watch highlights as Dawid Malan makes 127 and England beat New Zealand by 100 runs in the fourth one-day international at Lords to claim a 3-1 series victory.
articles.title: Malan century gives England series win over NZ

articles.description: Dawid Malan's sublime century inspires England to a series-clinching hammering of New Zealand in the fourth and final one-day international at Lord's.
articles.title: Malan ton seals England series win over New Zealand

articles.description: Rory McIlroy battled through a chaotic last-hole to finish on the projected cut mark of one under par at the BMW PGA Championship.
articles.title: McIlroy set to make cut amid chaotic scenes at Wentworth

articles.description: Wakefield are relegated from Super League after falling to a dramatic golden-point defeat at Leigh Leopards.
articles.title: Wakefield relegated after golden-point loss at Leigh

articles.description: Great Britain's Andy Murray dedicates his Davis Cup win over Switzerland's Leandro Riedi to his grandmother, after revealing he was missing her funeral to play in the tournament.
articles.title: Murray dedicates Davis Cup win to grandmother

articles.description: England coach Steve Borthwick suggests World Rugby's approach to high tackles has shifted in the wake of their intervention over an incident involving his captain Owen Farrell.
articles.title: Borthwick queries World Rugby high-hits approach
